required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy of AGN-210669 Ophthalmic Solution Compared With Bimatoprost Ophthalmic Solution in Patients With Open-Angle Glaucoma or Ocular Hypertension

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the safety and efficacy of AGN-210669 ophthalmic solution compared with bimatoprost ophthalmic solution (Lumigan®) as monotherapy and adjunctive therapy in patients with primary open-angle glaucoma or ocular hypertension.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Average Eye IOP
primary_outcome.description: IOP is a measurement of the fluid pressure inside the eye. The average of the 2 eyes are used for the analyses. A negative number change from baseline indicates a reduction in IOP (improvement) and a positive number change from baseline indicates an increase in IOP (worsening). Data are recorded at Hours 0, 4, 8, and 12.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Worse Eye IOP
secondary_outcome.description: IOP is a measurement of the fluid pressure inside the eye. The worse eye IOP refers to eye with the worse baseline IOP, which is determined as the eye with the higher mean diurnal IOP at baseline. If both eyes have the same mean diurnal IOP at baseline, the right eye is designated as the worse eye. A negative number change from baseline indicates a reduction in IOP (improvement) and a positive number change from baseline indicates an increase in IOP (worsening). Data are recorded at Hours 0, 4, 8, and 12.

arm_group.description: AGN-210669 0.05% applied as 1 drop in both eyes every evening during Month 1.
AGN-210669 0.05% + bimatoprost ophthalmic solution 0.03% applied as 1 drop of each treatment in both eyes every evening during Month 2.
AGN-210669 0.05% + bimatoprost ophthalmic solution 0.03% vehicle applied as 1 drop of each treatment in both eyes every evening during Month 2.
bimatoprost ophthalmic solution 0.03% applied as 1 drop in both eyes every evening during Month 1.
bimatoprost ophthalmic solution 0.03% + AGN-210669 0.05% applied as 1 drop of each treatment in both eyes every evening during Month 2.
bimatoprost ophthalmic solution 0.03% + bimatoprost ophthalmic solution 0.03% vehicle applied as 1 drop of each treatment in both eyes every evening during Month 2.

intervention.description: AGN-210669 0.05% applied as 1 drop in both eyes every evening during Month 1 or Month 2.
bimatoprost ophthalmic solution 0.03% applied as 1 drop in both eyes every evening during Month 1 or Month 2.
bimatoprost ophthalmic solution 0.03% vehicle applied as 1 drop in both eyes every evening during Month 2.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of primary open-angle glaucoma or ocular hypertension in each eye
- Requires bilateral treatment with an IOP-lowering medication
- Best corrected visual acuity of 20/100 or better in each eye
Exclusion Criteria:
- Use of oral, intramuscular, intravenous or topical ophthalmic corticosteroids within 2 months
- Inability to fast for up to 10 hours
- Prior refractive laser surgery (eg, LASIK, radial keratectomy, photorefractive keratectomy)
- Intraocular surgery or IOP-lowering laser surgery (eg, laser trabeculoplasty) within 6 months
- Current or anticipated use of artificial tears or any ocular medications aside from study medications during study
- Anticipated wearing of contact lenses during study

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Pts were randomized at Baseline for the entire study. At Mo 1, pts received either AGN-210669 or bimatoprost. At Mo 2, pts who had received AGN-210669, then received either AGN-210669+bimatoprost or AGN-210669+bimatoprost vehicle and pts who had received bimatoprost, then received either bimatoprost+AGN-210669 or bimatoprost+bimatoprost vehicle.

participants_list.participants: All patients who completed Month 1 were randomized to adjunctive therapy for Month 2.
All patients who completed Month 1 were randomized to adjunctive therapy for Month 2.
All patients who completed Month 1 were randomized to adjunctive therapy for Month 2.
All patients who completed Month 1 were randomized to adjunctive therapy for Month 2.

group.title: AGN-210669 Followed by AGN-210669 + Bimatoprost
group.description: AGN-210669 0.05% applied as 1 drop in each eye every evening for Month 1 followed by AGN-210669 0.05% + bimatoprost 0.03% applied as 1 drop of each treatment in both eyes every evening for Month 2.

group.title: AGN-210669 Followed by AGN-210669 + Bimatoprost Vehicle
group.description: AGN-210669 0.05% applied as 1 drop in each eye every evening for Month 1 followed by AGN-210669 0.05% + bimatoprost 0.03% vehicle applied as 1 drop of each treatment in both eyes every evening for Month 2.

group.title: Bimatoprost Followed by Bimatoprost + AGN-210669
group.description: bimatoprost 0.03% applied as 1 drop in each eye every evening for Month 1 followed by bimatoprost 0.03% + AGN-210669 applied as 1 drop of each treatment in both eyes every evening for Month 2.

group.title: Bimatoprost Followed by Bimatoprost + Bimatoprost Vehicle
group.description: bimatoprost 0.03% applied as 1 drop in each eye every evening for Month 1 followed by bimatoprost 0.03% + bimatoprost 0.03% vehicle applied as 1 drop of each treatment in both eyes every evening for Month 2.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Average Eye IOP
outcome.description: IOP is a measurement of the fluid pressure inside the eye. The average of the 2 eyes are used for the analyses. A negative number change from baseline indicates a reduction in IOP (improvement) and a positive number change from baseline indicates an increase in IOP (worsening). Data are recorded at Hours 0, 4, 8, and 12.
outcome.population: Modified Intent to Treat: all randomized and treated patients who had a baseline and at least 1 post-baseline IOP measurement

group.title: AGN-210669 Followed by AGN-210669 + Bimatoprost Vehicle
group.description: AGN-210669 0.05% + bimatoprost ophthalmic solution 0.03% vehicle applied as 1 drop of each treatment in both eyes every evening during Month 2.

group.title: Bimatoprost Followed by Bimatoprost + Bimatoprost Vehicle
group.description: bimatoprost ophthalmic solution 0.03% + bimatoprost ophthalmic solution 0.03% vehicle applied as 1 drop of each treatment in both eyes every evening during Month 2.

group.title: Combined Adjunctives
group.description: Combined adjunctives refer to the combined groups of ’AGN-210669 0.05% + bimatoprost’ and ’bimatoprost + AGN-210669 0.05%’. The first treatment is applied as 1 drop in each eye every evening for Month 1 followed by AGN-210669 0.05% + bimatoprost 0.03% applied as 1 drop of each treatment in both eyes every evening for Month 2.

reported_events.desc: The Safety Population was used to assess adverse events (AEs) and serious adverse events (SAEs) and included all treated patients. SAEs and AEs are presented by treatment arm not necessarily by individual treatment received.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: A disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 90 days from the time submitted to the sponsor for review. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
